Posted By: InternetNinjacy (8/25/2010 5:07:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I looooove vanilla creatures, but I don't feel the creature type is right for this kind of card. If he (she?) was some sort of 'acolyte' wizard that had a wizard lord who could make use of him/her, then that would be cool. How would a wizard lord make use of his acolytes? Well first he could do the usual thing of giving them all +1/+1, then maybe you could tap a number of wizards to return a creature to its owner's hand, or some other blue ability. If it was black, the lord could sac one of his acolytes for mana or something.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@scumbling:  
Powercreep tends to occur at rare and higher levels of rarity. For instance, look at [Grizzly Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bears). Now look at [Kavu Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kavu Titan). While many people like to complain about powercreep, myself included, I recognize that it's a part of the game. That doesn't make it any less of a reality or reduce the annoyance.
posts.html:
@scumbling:

Posted By: TDL (4/8/2011 11:44:46 PM)

posts.post_content:
Yes, this is a bad card mechanically: It's [Merfolk of the Pearl Trident](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk of the Pearl Trident), with a much less relevant creature type. That'd be enough to bump it down to 1 star.  
  
But the flavor takes it the rest of the way down to a half. Why in the world is a *wizard*, of all things, vanilla? Just call it "Fugitive", and make it creature type "human", for crying out loud.
posts.html:
Yes, this is a bad card mechanically: It's Merfolk of the Pearl Trident, with a much less relevant creature type. That'd be enough to bump it down to 1 star.

But the flavor takes it the rest of the way down to a half. Why in the world is a wizard, of all things, vanilla? Just call it "Fugitive", and make it creature type "human", for crying out loud.

posts.post_content:
There was some legendary wizard from the Kamigawa block that allows its controller to tap a wizard to draw a card. Other wizards (and other cards) have wizard-centric effects. This is NOT a useless card, NOT the worst card in the game, and NOT the worst creature in the game.  
  
Kids are spoiled these days. **sc\*mbling1**: Power Creep.
